intro: Rhizium, commonly known as the root fungus, is a genus of fungi that forms symbiotic relationships with the roots of various plants. These fungi are essential in the process of nitrogen fixation, helping plants absorb nitrogen from the soil. Rhizium species are often found in the soil and can be beneficial to plant growth when they colonize the root system. They produce thread-like structures called hyphae that extend into the soil, enhancing nutrient uptake. However, some species of Rhizium can cause plant diseases, such as root rot, depending on environmental conditions.
